ratings.rComments: Good professor overall. Project was fun, and we learned a lot from it. Lectures were clear and he is very approachable. Will try and work his hardest to ensure your success

I had high expectations for Ray, but was kind of disappointed. He had lots of office hours, but they weren't as helpful as I'd hoped. He's an ok teacher, but there were many areas where we were left to fill in the gaps/find the unwritten rules. For as hard as the tests were, he needed to have been more thorough in his teaching and homework problems

Dr. Ray is such an amazing teacher. I didn't like chemistry very much going into the class, but my opinion has entirely changed. He explains very well and there are a ton of ways he presents the material. You have to put in work to do well, but the material is so well presented that it's not hard to keep up. I couldn't recommend anyone more.

Took 104C which has a group project which was interesting but rushed. Ray wasa great teacher and did his best to get everyone to understand material. Glad I took this section. Never used the textbook but it was free!

Up until I took this class, I hated chemistry. I used to do terrible in even the easiest high school chemistry class but this course has completely changed that. The professor is super friendly and turn chemistry into something you can enjoy. He holds office hours by himself and clearly understands what each student is having difficulty with.

One of the best professors I've ever had. Extremely personable, brilliant, and knows what he's doing when it comes to teaching. Lectures are enjoyable. The material is hard, but he explains it clearly and thoroughly. Also extremely helpful at office hours. For CHEM 104, take advantage of the optional problems that are available online.

He is one of the best professor I had during my time at UIUC. Yes, his class is hard, but it's chemistry at U of I so that is expected. He lectures clearly, and is also clear about what is expected of you. If you go in to office hours, he is the most helpful and genuine professor you could have. I would recommend him as a professor any time!

Amiable character, but absolutely disastrous as an instructor. He overstates this fantastical concept of "critical thinking", which turn out to be quixotic when exams are expected to be completed in blitz speed this giving little room for "thinking time". Quite ironic indeed as he expects one thing, and does not provide the resources to meet them.

Professor Ray was a great lecturer. He reinforced the material presented in the pre-lectures and his tests and homework was right in line with what he was teaching. He's been the best professor I've had at the U of I. I would definitely make you schedule work around having him as a teacher.

I took him after having a semester with Overcash who was pretty awful. Ray's a great teacher and really cares about his students doing well. He also offers retakes and all the tests. Keep up with the material and you should do fine. He also posts pre and post lecture videos online which are very helpful. Best teacher for 104

I took this class when he taught chem 204, but the material is pretty much the same as 104. He is the best option for 104. Tests are hard, and he claims he doesn't curve, but he does. He offers retakes as well. Just keep up with all of his material. An A shouldn't be hard to obtain at all.
Enjoyable to go to class.
He's one of those professors where you learn more about him than the actual course.
Ray is the best teacher that you can get for Chem 104. Work your schedule around his availability. He makes things clear and exam resemble what is gone over in class.

He is the best, he teaches in the most simplest terms, however his tests really test the concepts that are learned in class. SO YOU BETTER KNOW YOUR STUFF. Watch the online videos because they really help, do all your homework assignments. Also he makes class really FUN!

After a terrible semester in CHEM 102 with Jamieson, I didn't think I could look at chemistry ever again. But Ray actually made me have an interest in chemistry. He is literally the best chem professor I've ever had!I wish he could teach all of my chem classes. If you have a choice, PICK RAY!
Took his chemistry class my freshman year. He is a great professor

He was a good teacher and the class was pretty easy with him. He was new to the class and his tests are pretty simple. You just want to make sure you go to his review sessions because they help especially before the exam
Best Professor I have ever had.
He is a fantastic professor! Just amazing! He really cares about the students learning. His   tests are difficult but really put in perspective what the material is about. Take him!

Dr. Ray is probably the best professor I have had at U of I. He really loves teaching and cares about students. He is always willing to help. Also, the class isn't that hard. The online quizzes were the hardest part, but he lets you work in groups. Overall, he's a great professor.

Favorite class I've taken in college.  Dr. Ray is a great professor and is super helpful during office hours.  Go to office hours the day or two before exams and ask how to do the practice test Q's and you're golden for exams.

He's not that bad. He's really nice, cares about making his students learn, and is really helpful. You don't need to go to class, because he posts lecture videos online that get straight to the point and are exactly the same(rather than sitting in a 50min class)He even curved our class at the end!

One of the best professors I've had. You can tell he has enthusiasm for the subject. Real nice guy and his exams are fair. If you make sure to understand the homework you should be getting an A, the material isn't that hard. The only thing I found annoying was that sometimes the review sheet for the exam wouldn't be posted until two days prior...

He offers multiple ways for you to learn the course. Online lectures were very efficient and well done. Of course, like many chem courses at UIUC, material is not homogeneous, so expect much harder exams than homework and quizzes. And for Fall 2012, half the class is --not-- failing, more like 10-ish% after curve.

Dr. Ray probably the best teacher I've had at U of I.  If you ever struggle with a concept, go to his office hours. The class is not hard if you put the time into study and do the suggested practice problems. He writes hard tests  but offers online retakes that can get you point back for the original test. This man was meant to teach chemistry.

Chemistry is something I really struggle with, and the only reason I'm doing so well is because Dr. Ray is a fantastic teacher. It is a difficult class, but he's absolutely wonderful. He tries to put everything at students' fingertips so that they can do as well as possible. He really cares about his students.

He's really nice but a terrible teacher. He doesn't explain things very well and expects you to learn most of the material on your own. His online lecture videos are sort of helpful but he doesn't go into much detail.

Professor Ray was one of the best professors I've had so far at the University. He's passionate about teaching and is extremely helpful when it comes to helping students understand the material. He makes pre/post lecture videos which really help. Practice problems; that's the key!

I hate Chemistry. Dr. Ray is incredibly nice. Never met a teacher who cares so much about his students. He wants you to understand more than anything. Everyone warned that he was hard but honestly I thought his exams were very fair if you actually study and do practice problems. Extremely helpful during office hours. I wish he taught Orgo.

If you go to his office hours he really makes an effort to get to know you and find a way to help you out that works for you.  He tailors his explanations to your learning style.  With all this, he is a difficult professor and his midterms are challenging, but doable.  Much better than Hummel.
His office hours should really be used. He is extremely helpful when people just ask. He also has lecture videos that are greta for studying and catching up if you miss class.

Really wonderful. Loves to tell stories but also teaches in a nice manner. Numerous examples and an abundance of practice material. Exams are exactly what he warns you they will be. Overall, awesome class. Dr. Ray loves his job and it is apparent through his teaching.

Dr. Ray is awesome. He definitely loves his jobs and is interested in what he teaches. He is always willing to help and does not want his students to fail. His exams are a bit rough but he gives great practice problems and practice exams. Just go to class and take notes.

Nicest guy I've met yet. Feels bad when we are confused or don't understand. Loves to teach. He'll help you with any problem you might have. Exams are fine if you study decently. Uses a peculiar system to get points back once you've taken them. His video lectures online are gold. Answers questions during lecture. He is such a good person.

Great Professor! He helps you if you have ANY questions, and his pre/post lecture videos are AWESOME! This class is totally doable if you put the effort in! Watch the videos, attend lectures, and do the practice exams, and you will do just fine! :) Dr. Ray is by far the best professor I've had thus far!

fantastic teacher. Very good at explaining hard concepts and answering student questions. Easy to approach and relates well with students. You really want to have Dr. Ray if you plan on taking Orgo, his class lays a wonderful fondation for CHEM 232.
he is literally the best. i love going to lecture because he's funny and clear and very willing to help. tests are hard, but you get a chance to make up some points for each test

Couldn't have asked for a better professor. He asks a lot of you in his exams, but what he gives you is outstanding. He has pre-lecture videos (5 min. long) so you're prepared for lecture, post-lecture videos in case something isn't clear, and any question you ask him will get answered. Don't take anyone but Ray for CHEM 104.

The guy was great for the first month.  Then he had a baby and everything went downhill.  I was in the online section and he was supposed to post videos lectures every week.  Ended up being three weeks behind schedule.  I had to learn the entire three weeks and the current week of material for an exam within 4 days.  I'm an A student, he burned me.

Good lecturer! Very clear, and explains most things well. I worked pretty hard but did not dedicate as much time as I could have to the class - don't make that mistake! On a regular basis you should watch the pre-lecture videos, go to lecture, then review the lecture. For exams, review notes and take the practice tests.
Great professor! Always open to answering your questions. Exams can be a little bit challenging but if you go to your discussion or his Friday tutoring sessions you should be just fine.

Really great teacher. He goes out of his way to make sure you understand, but the catch is, YOU have to ask him. Never had a question go unanswered. Online lectures are exactly what is covered in class so it is very good review material. If you study and actually ask him to explain stuff to you, he will. Great class, hope to have him in future.

Dr. Ray really wants his students to learn and tries to help as much as possible.  He also personalizes the class which is cool.  The material is hard (especially orgo) but go to class and study a lot.

Watch pre-lecture videos before lectures, read the book for what is unclear, go to class knowing what is discussed that day, participate during it, DO NOT BE AFRAID of asking questions, watch the post-lecture videos, go to his Friday tutoring, go to office hours if you must, and you'll be golden. Made me love chemistry and pursue biochem.

He talks a lot, but he's adorable, easy going, funny in a dorky way, DILF. :D He writes difficult exams, but he is an AWESOME teacher, and he puts the lectures online, which are really convenient and concise.
The best professor I've ever had. He actually cares. Office hours help a ton.

good lecturer. very clear, and explains everything well. Got an A+ in the class, didn't work exorbitantly hard. Watch the prelecture video, go to lecture, then review lecture. Then just review notes for the exams, and take the practice tests. Tests are not that hard provided you are not an idiot. most of the test problems are exactly like homework
great professor. his lecture video and notes help a lot. glad to help his students. exam is kinda difficult however if u have done the previous exam u should be fine

A bit pretentious and annoying. Course material and test material didn't always match up. Felt unprepared for tests, had to show up for class but ironically didn't learn too much from them that would actually benefit me on the test.

Great teacher. ALWAYS open to answer questions. His lecture videos are very helpful, and he holds review sessions every week. It's a tough class, exams are difficult.  If you put in the work and take advantage of all the practice problems, review sessions, and lecture videos you should be fine.

If you don't like chemistry, this class is tough. Class attendance and discussions are helpful, but not always good enough. I studied for every test and could only achieve a C or D. Quizzes were somewhat difficult. Do the practice problems from the book. Doing  minimum work will not get you a B. Tests resembled the practice ones and were fair.

Hes a cool professor to talk to, but hes really not a good teacher.  I found his exams to be unreasonably hard despite studying.  Hes a fairly nice guy, but I would definately recommend Yerkes or Shapely...He expects you to go out and learn alot of stuff on your own.  I felt like I put in alot of time into the class but was not happy with my grade.

Ray is definitely a cool guy who is excited about teaching and relates well with his students.  Nevertheless, his exams were very difficult.  And since they are multiple choice, it is really easy to lose points fast.  I would for sure recommend Ray to anyone taking chem 104, but be prepared to study hard.
Great teacher. I could tell he really cared about the individual success of his students and would go out of his way to help.

I truly felt that he taught better and in a more efficient manner in his lecture videos than his physical lectures, so I rarely went to those. When finishing exams, make sure to check those over because every question is .7% of your grade. Because of the unreleased criteria he uses for the grading scale, nobody really knows his grade until the end.

Dr. Ray is tough, and if you miss a lecture its easy to fall behind & hard to catch up.  Sometimes its hard to understand, but he's always open to questions, if u keep them specific.  His curve is generous, so as long as you try you should be able to pass.  Be prepared to put in a lot of work and be sure to have a friend you can work with..it helps
Really helpful, funny, and reasonable. Go to lectures and things will come much more easily. Be prepared to learn plenty about his family!
Great teacher. He explains subject matter quite well. Exams are tough tho. Be prepared to work hard on org chem.

This professor is the best I've had at UIUC. I hate and am terrible at chemistry but he made it completely enjoyable. He cares about the students and does everything in his power to get his students to understand and learn the material. He will challenge you on exams but he does well in preparing you.

GREAT TEACHER. He made chem so much fun. People in other reviews bag on him, but honeslty they probably didn't do the practice problems or watch the NUMEROUS lecture videos that he posted, and they probably didn't go to his review sessions that he holds every friday. GREAT TEACHER. Ignore the negative posts. Take him if you can!!!!!

If you can get in his lecture, TAKE IT. He is a great professor. I hate chemistry, but LOVED this class. He has tons of lecture videos and prelecture videos, practice problems, suggested problems, and ton's of help available. Go to lecture, get your clicker points, WATCH the videos he posts, and do the suggested/practice problems and you've got an
I love love love him. I hate chemistry but you can tell how much he cares about his students and puts in so much effort to help you succeed!

Excellent professor in all aspects. The best lecturer I've had. Not an easy class, but any problems you have you can post on the compass site, and he will probably respond on the same day... very helpful. Also manages to make chemistry fun. Highly recommended.

Great professor! Actually makes me enjoy going to lecture. Gives you all the tools you need to do well and thoroughly understand the material, including tons of practice problems. My best professor at this university so far.

All in all great teacher. His power points are organized and his pre lecture videos are very helpful. Also has a lot of suggested problems to help prepare. Exams aren't bad at all, wayyy easier than yerkes' exams. I actually enjoyed going to class. And he's a hot live version of Doug Funny...
Best Professor I have had so far here!!! This lecture videos he posts on compass are so helpful.. if you miss lecture you have no problem catching up! I love his class!

He's one of the best professors I've ever had. Very good at teaching and really cares about how his students are doing. Puts a lot of effort into this class! Exams really test you, but LONCAPA, quizzes, and the curve should boost your grade.

Dr. Ray is a good professor if you go to his office hours, prepare your questions in advance, and ask him directly outside of his lectures.  The problem is that his office hours are often extremely filled because he is quite popular, so it's very hard to get his help when there are so many people surrounding him.  He is nice, but overrated.

Great lecturer. Responds well from student feedback and genuinely cares if you don't understand concepts or need help. The only drawback is that he really tests you with his exams. But if you put forth the effort, I'm sure you should do fine in his class.
An ok class. Exams can be tough though. And Ray is not very helpful.

Dr. Ray was one of the best professors ive ever had! i never have written a review on a professor before but Ray is worth commenting on. Excellent teaching, not exactly easy material but Ray is very fair and if you go to class (which i would HIGHLY reccomend for chemistry) and put in the time/effort you will be fine.
Taught material well. His tests were hard, but the curve made up for my poor scores on the tests and I received an A.

My favorite professor yet! I loved dr. ray! Although the material is not very easy, he does everything possible to help you learn and gives plenty of opportunities to have things explained outside of lecture. Go to lecture and discussion and its a pretty easy class. Dr. Ray is AWESOME!

Dr. Ray is 'friendly' and interesting and, it seems at first at least, genuine. But if you read his 'teaching philosophy' on the Chem dept website it is all spelled out. To me he did not appear spontaneous; it was as if he was too mechanical. After a while the 'novelty', if any, wears of and you almost start wishing for a more genuine professor.

Take Chem 104 with Dr.Ray!He is a great professor,and very down-to-earth.Favorite prof so far!He does challenge you,but pay attention,do suggested problems,and take advantage of his online office hours and the TAs to master it.The class is curved since the tests are challenging.He is really good at explaining complicated things.He made me like chem
Dr. Ray is my favorite professor thus far in college. He's cool, smart, and his exams are very straighforward as long as you understand the material. Overall he's a cool professor.

He is well liked by students because he does not have an attitude problem and appears enthusiastic about what he is doing. He is not,however,very good at it. He often relies upon prepared notes, sometimes seem a bit confused -and it is not too difficult to loose focus during class. Some demos are all style and no substnce. Overall, he is ok.

Ray is a fun-loving guy. He is a great guy but I'm not sure if he's a great professor. He seems to prejudice one over the other and his tests are extremly hard compared to the tests of the other Chem 104 professor.
Dr. Ray is a great teacher. He made going to class worth the effort. He also provided a great pre-organic chemistry base before heading onto organic chemistry.

Rey makes his class interesting and fun to attend which is very refreshing after CHEM102 which made me hate chem. His lectures include lots of demos and he clearly explains everything which is unique to this campus. Definitely recommend!
Amazing!  Be sure to do suggested problems, lectures were helpful
One of the few entertaining lectures ever! I actually loved going to his class! A good advise for this class is to do the suggested problems and read his notes and you are good! Now I love chem!
Terrific instructor with energy, enthusiasm, and the rare ability to connect with an auditorium sized class.

Dr. Ray is a really good guy, he is very helpful and very approachable, Class is tough but if you do practice problems, go to office hours, do the readings, you should be good. This class is all about how much effort you are willing to put into it. If you are gonna take this class, I would say take it with Dr. Ray.
Dr. Ray is an amazing teacher! Loved this class.
I absolutely looove him!  He was so great and chemistry ROCKS!!  The class is awesome and he's hott!!!!!  He's also good at teaching :)

Super awesome chemistry teacher.  Seriously, if you have to take this class make sure to get Ray!  Not only does he make chem really interesting, he's just overall a great teacher.  Do all the suggested problems (trust me you'll be thankful on the exams) and do practice exams and go to class!  Chem 104 is nothing but a good time with Ray!!!!

Dr. Ray is an awesome professor.  He absolutely loves teaching, and he always talks about how it is his dream job.  I'm really glad I had him instead of Dr. Yerkes.  She bores me to death, and doesn't really teach.  Dr. Ray keeps you interested.  You should see his lectures.  They are packed full!

Dr. Ray is an amazing teacher.  He's incredibly helpful, and as long as you do the suggested problems, go to every lecture, and understand the material the class will be a lot easier.  Before exams review suggested problems and do all of the old exams!  Dr. Ray is extremely helpful, so use the Chem 104 website frequently.  Awesome class!
Fun teacher; last day of class is "blow stuff up day." Tests have the usual tricky questions. In comparison to Yerkes: Yerkes teaches better but Ray is more entertaining.
All around great guy. He loves what he is doing, is always willing to help you, and always has some sort of demo during class. If you apply yourself, it should be an easy A.
good lecturer. somewhat interesting, good demos, seems like he cares about students

He's GREAT! Lectures were actually understandable and he had GREAT demos! Obviously it's a hard class- but with a lot of work you can get a great grade. Ray made things really clear and he's a really nice guy.
Good guy, definitely makes lectures worth going to. A lot of cool demos, explains things well, but he doesnt just lay everything out in front of you.  Exams are fair and curved well.

The corey matthews look-a-like really makes class interesting, so that you wish there was more time. You don't receive a grade for homework, but you HAVE to do it to do well on exams! Take quizzes seriously, too.

Great professor.  Makes a real effort to constantly improve his teaching.  If you read the book before lecture and do the problems he recommends you doing, you will succeed.  I never thought I liked chemistry, but now I have a definite interest in it.
Great professor!  Had easily understandable and very enjoyable classes!  Also, gave fair exams. Definitely recommended!
Dr. Ray is amazing.  Definitely one of my favorite professors.  He makes boring chemistry interesting.

Very enthusiastic professor!  Extremely hard tests, but the curves aren't too bad.  I would definitely go to office hours to catch up on stuff you don't understand.  Prof. Ray will only get better as he gets more experienced!  I would definitely take his class!  Go Cubs!

Dr. Ray is fantastic. I am terrible at chemistry and was excited to go to lectures... he makes the material interesting. Office hours were very helpful--he was great at rephrasing things I didn't understand and was really interested in my success. It's a tough class, you have to put in the effort, but Dr. Ray is a great professor.
Very interesting professor, always brings in current events that deal with what we are learning. Great speaker. Hard exams.

Dr. Ray is great.  He does fun demos and his teaching methods are awesome.  His focus for research is improving chemistry teaching, so he definitely knows his stuff. And he's great at chemistry too, but thats really just a bonus.

He was a super nice guy, however his lectures were so broad that when it came time to do the homework, I was lost. His tests are super hard and I feel like he almost sets us up to fail. Overall, nice guy but not so good at teaching.
Hard tests, but very fair grader and generous with curves. Lots of demos, good analogies in class

Nice teacher but not all that clear. Instead of having power points he writes his notes by hand on the board which really reduced the amount of information you can learn in class. But go to lecture because his test questions are derived directly from lecture. The 1st test is hard just to scare you and the rest are easier- final was very easy!

Dr. Ray was amazing. Sometimes in lecture things could get a little confusing but he tried really hard to give real life examples. Go to his office hours! It really helped me understand better plus he is really fun to talk to about other stuff not related to chem. I think he will get better the more he teaches.  Best chem teacher I have had
very helpful and enthusiastic. lets you know exactly what will be on the test. beware of all the whiners in chem 104.
Entertaining-makes you want to come to class; helpful in office hours; takes personal interest in students' progress.

Nice guy but if you take the class learn concepts more in depth then what is presented in class. Tests require that you know ALL of chem and he teaches only about 20% of it in lecture. You are better off staying home and reading the book.
he was a good teacher, pretty helpful. didnt mind if you came into his office at anytime.
Even though I'm doing really bad in his class, his lectures were interesting... I enjoyed taking his class, and I may be taking it next semester too! :(

Not ready for lecturing at all.  I learned more in my discussion than in lecture.  Horrible explainer and doesn't give any examples for anything he explains.  He hardly prepares you enough for the tests which were hard.  I wasn't great at chemistry in the first place and he did not help at all.  If only I had known this before...
No Comments
Great (young) guy, but would barely cut it as a TA.  Definately not ready to lecture.  Explanations are confused--he clearly does not have much experience with Chem 104.
